qas.question: Who made the film O Tamaiti?
What was Sima Urale's first feature-length production?
What movie was the first ever all-Samoan production?
Who wrote and directed The Orator?
In what year did Apron Strings star as the opening film of the NZ International Film Festival?
What film directed by Oscar Knightley won Best Short Film in 1996?
What event did the first feature film made by Oscar Knightley open?
What was the name of the first fully Samoan film made in 1996?
Who wrote and directed Siones Wedding in 2011?
Where did the film Apron Strings receive critical acclaim and attention in 2011?

context: Director <a0_0>Sima Urale<a0_0/> is an award-winning filmmaker. Urale's short film <b5_0>O Tamaiti<b5_0/> won the prestigious Best Short Film at the Venice Film Festival in 1996. Her first feature film <a1_0>Apron Strings<a1_0/> opened <b6_0>the <a4_0>2008<a4_0/> NZ International Film Festival<b6_0/>. The feature film Siones Wedding, co-written by Oscar Kightley, was financially successful following premieres in Auckland and Apia. The 2011 film <a2_0><b7_0>The Orator<b7_0/><a2_0/> was the first ever fully Samoan film, shot in Samoa in the Samoan language with a Samoan cast telling a uniquely Samoan story. Written and directed by <a3_0><b8_0>Tusi Tamasese<b8_0/><a3_0/>, it received much critical acclaim and attention at film festivals <b9_0>throughout the world<b9_0/>.
